title: Purai
text:
Purai is a village in <a href="Sataon">Sataon</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 15 km west of <a href="Raebareli">Raebareli</a>, the district headquarters, near the point where the <a href="Basaha">Basaha</a> stream joins the <a href="Sai%20River%20%28Uttar%20Pradesh%29">Sai river</a>. As of 2011, the population of Purai is 5,652, in 1,108 households. It hosts a <a href="haat">haat</a> twice per week, on Wednesdays and Sundays. There are 4 primary schools and no healthcare facilities in the village.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Purai (here spelled "Porai") as comprising 13 hamlets, with a total population of 2,303 people (1,190 male and 1,113 female), in 445 households and 400 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 1,979 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Purai (here spelled "Porai") as having a population of 3,656 people, in 701 households, and having an area of 796.45 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were given as wheat and rice.
